titleStmt.title: The narrative of the most material proceedings at the sessions for London and Middlesex, begun July the seventh, 1680 Giving an account of the proceedings against John Giles, for being one of those that made the late barbarous attempt upon Justice Arnold. As also of divers other persons convicted of several murders, robberies on the high-way, burglaries, and other felonies; and all other remarkable tryals there: together with the names and crimes of all that received sentence of death; the number of those burnt in the hand, &c.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Court of Quarter Sessions of the Peace (London)

notesStmt.note: Place of publication from Wing (CD-ROM edition).
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
